en.title: PROJECT BLOOM
en.creditsDesc: Written by: David Dionisio Music from: Kevin Macleod Photos: Sahara (Kent Larsson), Road to the Isles (Trevor Wright), Similkameen River (Greg Shine, BLM), Costa Brava (Gordito1869), Puerto Rico (Oquendo)
en.levelMatchDesc: Find the location that matches the climate.
en.levelMatchNotFound: Climate does not match, try another location.
en.weatherSunnyDesc: Sun is visible for most of the day with few scattered clouds.
en.weatherPartlySunnyDesc: Less than half the sky is covered by clouds.
en.weatherMostlyCloudyDesc: Clouds cover the sky for more than 60%.
en.weatherCloudyDesc: Clouds cover almost all of the sky.
en.weatherLightRainDesc: A small amount of water accumulates from the rain over the day.
en.weatherRainDesc: A moderate amount of water accumulates from the rain over the day.
en.weatherOvercastDesc: Clouds cover the sky over 90%. The sun is practically invisible for the entire day.
en.weatherFogDesc: Clouds have formed at ground level, causing low visibility.
en.weatherHazeDesc: Particles of dusts hang over the air due to the gusts of wind, causing low visibility.
en.weatherSandstormDesc: Strong wind carries a dangerous amount of sand causing massive havoc, and low visibility.
en.weatherLightSnowDesc: A small amount of snow accumulates over the day. Low visibility is expected.
en.weatherSnowDesc: A moderate amount of snow accumulates over the day. Low visibility is expected.
en.weatherBlizzardDesc: A combination of strong wind, and freezing temperature. Falling large debris of ice is to be expected throughout the day.
en.unitAllyCollectorDesc: These frogs will be gathering water from a nearby source. Please protect them as they traverse the land!
en.unitAllyGardenerDesc: These frogs will tend to the garden to help grow the flowers, and rid them of pesky weeds.
en.unitAllyMalletDesc: Deploy these hardy frogs to crush pesky rodents from the ground.
en.unitAllySpearmanDesc: Deploy these frogs to fight against the pests that plague the sky.
en.unitAllySunflyDesc: These flies are capable of generating warmth to help flowers grow in cold weather, as well as melt ice.
en.unitAllyWindBlockerDesc: Deploy these frogs to protect the flowers from being blown away by dangerous wind.
en.climateTypeAridDesc: These climates are dry areas that receive little to no rain over a stretch of time. Not much vegetations can grow in these areas.
en.climateTypeContinentalDesc: Continental climates are found in regions away from the sea. They generally have four seasons: spring, summer, autumn, and winter.
en.climateTypeMarineWestCoastDesc: Oceanic (or Maritime) are influenced by ocean currents and are generally located next to the sea. The temperature range is fairly narrow, with cool summers and winters.
en.climateTypeMediterraneanDesc: Mediterranean climates are generally found in coastal regions, where the water is warm. The temperature is mild and musty.
en.climateTypePolarDesc: Arctic climate is defined by its long frigid winter, and short cool summer. They are at the very top and bottom of Earth where the sun barely shines.
en.climateTypeRainforestDesc: Rainforest climate is defined by its frequent rain, and high humidity. Because of this, these areas are dense with trees and vegetations.
en.locationOutbackDesc: The outback is located within Australia. Its biome consists of: tropical, savanna, and desert.
en.locationGreatPlainsDesc: The Great Plains is the broad flat lands in the middle of North America. Its biome is mostly made up of: prairie (flat grassy fields) and badlands (plateaus and canyons).
en.locationSaharaDesc: The Sahara is currently the largest hot desert in the world, located in North Africa. Its biome is predominantly a desert.
en.locationBritishIslesDesc: The British Isles are a group of islands located on the northwestern coast of Europe. Its biome is mostly that of a temperate forest.
en.locationPacificNorthwestDesc: The Pacific Northwest is a region of North America between the Pacific Ocean and the mountain range. Its biome mostly consists of a coniferous forest (pine and evergreen trees).
en.locationCostaBravaDesc: Located in the northeast coastal region of Spain. Its biome consists of: dry forest and scrubs.
en.locationGreenlandDesc: Greenland is the world’s largest island located in the North Atlantic Ocean. Its biome mostly consists of a tundra.
en.locationSiberiaDesc: Siberia is a vast region north of Russia. Its biome mostly consists of a snow forest (taiga).
en.locationBrazilDesc: Brazil is a country in the upper region of South America located next to the Atlantic Ocean. Its biome mostly consists of the Amazonian rainforest.
en.locationPuertoRicoDesc: Puerto Rico is a self-governed island associated with the United States located in the northeast Caribbean Sea. Its biome mostly consists of a rainforest.
en.intro01: Welcome to Project Bloom! We are conducting an experiment to grow some special flowers in various climates.
en.intro02: We need you to help train these fine capable frogs to nurture and protect the flowers.
en.tutorialLevelSelect01: This is a satellite map of Earth. Help us find a suitable location to land our seedling based on the target climate.
en.tutorialLevelSelect02: You can press the image of the climate to get more information.
en.tutorialDragInstruction: Drag the card towards the playing field.
en.tutorialWeatherInfo: Press any of the weather for more info!
en.level1Summary02: Weather describes the atmospheric condition at a specific region, and period of time. This is typically in hour-to-hour, day-to-day.
en.level1Summary03: Climate describes the average weather over a long period of time at a specific region. This can be 30 years, or even over a century.
en.level2Summary02: Certain local areas can have a different pattern of weather than the main climate. This can be as small as a garden patch, or even a cave. As an example: a mountain or a hill can block the sunlight for most of the time, causing a cooler region.
en.level3Summary02: These are rare types of weather that can cause havoc across a region. Their atmospheric condition such as the wind and temperature are off the charts. Severe weathers are considered to be dangerous, and can put you in a perilous situation.
en.postGameDialog01: Now that we have enough climate data of Earth, we just need to verify their category on each climate zone.
en.postGameDialog02: You have been a great help, but we need you one more time to correctly match these climates. For science!
